name: EOD Primary Tumor
title: EOD Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** The bones of the lateral wall of the nasal cavity include the maxilla, the perpendicular plate of the palatine bone, the medial pterygoid plate, the labyrinth and inferior concha of the ethmoid. The roof of the nasal cavity is formed by the nasal bone. The floor of the nasal cavity, which forms the roof of the mouth, is composed of the bones of the hard palate: the horizontal plate of the palatine bone posteriorly and the palatine process of the maxilla anteriorly.

**Note 2:** Involvement of or extension to bone includes any type of tumor extension to the bone, such as erosion, invasion, extension, penetration, or destruction.

**Note 3:** "Bony invasion" does not include extension to palate, cribriform plate, or pterygoid plates. Extension to these structures is coded separately.

**Note 4:** “Bony invasion” does include involvement of perpendicular plate of ethmoid bone or ethmoid air cells.

**Note 5:** Code 300 for base of skull, NOS when there is no information available for more specific bony structures in the skull.

**Note 6:** Minimal extension to anterior cranial fossa implies tumor pushing through the cribriform plate, but without invasion of the dura or brain.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 3-30

(5) Lydiatt, W.M., Patel, S.G., Shah, J.P., et al.  **Staging Head and Neck Cancers**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 55-65

(6) Kraus, D.H., Lydiatt, W.M., Shah, J.P., et al. **Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinuses**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 137-147
rows:
All sites
- Localized, NOS

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites WITHOUT bony invasion
   + Floor
   + Lateral wall, including
       * Meatus (superior, middle, inferior) 
       * Nasal conchae (superior, middle, inferior)
   + Septum
   + Vestibule (edge of naris to mucocutaneous junction)
- Confined to nasal cavity, NOS

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Confined to ethmoid sinus  
  + WITH or WITHOUT bony invasion (involvement of perpendicular plate of ethmoid bone or ethmoid air cells)
- Confined to ethmoid sinus, NOS

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Confined to one subsite listed in code 100
  + WITH bony invasion

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Confined to two or more subsites listed in code 100
  + WITHOUT bony invasion

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Confined to two or more subsites listed in code 100 WITH bony invasion
    + Choana
    + Ethmoid sinus
- Nasolacrimal duct

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Confined to both ethmoid sinuses 
  + WITH or WITHOUT bony invasion (involvement of perpendicular plate of ethmoid bone or ethmoid air cells)
- Nasal cavity WITH or WITHOUT bony invasion, one or more subsites
    + Floor
    + Lateral wall, including
        * Meatus (superior, middle, inferior)
        * Nasal conchae (superior, middle, inferior)
    + Septum
    + Turbinates
    + Vestibule (edge of naris to mucocutaneous junction)

All sites
- Base of skull, NOS
- Cribriform plate

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Adjacent organs/structures, NOS
- Hard palate

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Orbital plate
- Maxillary sinus
- Medial wall or floor of orbit

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Maxillary sinus
- Medial wall or floor of orbit
- Orbital plate

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Hard palate

All sites
- Frontal sinus
- Pterygoid plates

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
 - Anterior cranial fossa (minimal extension)
 - Anterior orbital contents
 - Skin of cheek
 - Skin of nose
 - Sphenoid sinus

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Anterior cranial fossa (minimal extension)
- Anterior orbital contents
- Skin of cheek
- Skin of nose
- Sphenoid sinus

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Any structure in code 500 + hard palate

All sites
- Nasopharynx

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Brain
- Clivus
- Cranial nerves (other than V2, maxillary division of trigeminal nerve)
- Dura
- Middle cranial fossa
- Orbital apex

All sites
- Further contiguous extension

Nasal Cavity (C300)
- Brain
- Clivus
- Cranial nerves (other than V2, maxillary division of trigeminal nerve)
- Dura
- Middle cranial fossa
- Orbital apex

Ethmoid Sinus (C311)
- Any structure in code 600 + hard palate

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed 
Not documented in patient record

Death Certificate Only
